Class PassengerGroup

java.lang.Object
  PassengerGroup

public class PassengerGroup
extends Object

Represents a collection of passengers traveling in an elevator. This is implemented as a priority queue so that the next passenger's floor can be easily computed.

Field Summary
private  Comparator<Passenger> comp
           
private  Passenger[] group

          Indicates if this group is empty.

          Indicates if this group is full

          This method will compare the element at the given index with it's children.
private  void moveUp(int indx)

 String toString()
          Returns a string representation of this group.
 void useMaxFloors()
          Sets this passenger group to use a Passenger.MaxFloor comparator to determine priority, appropriate for passenger groups in descending elevators.
 void useMinFloors()
          Sets this passenger group to use a Passenger.MinFloor comparator to determine priority, appropriate for passenger groups in ascending elevators.

public PassengerGroup(int maxsize)
Creates a new Passenger group with a given max capacity

Parameters:
maxsize - - the maximum passenger capacity
Method Detail

useMinFloors

public void useMinFloors()
Sets this passenger group to use a Passenger.MinFloor comparator to determine priority, appropriate for passenger groups in ascending elevators.

useMaxFloors

public void useMaxFloors()
Sets this passenger group to use a Passenger.MaxFloor comparator to determine priority, appropriate for passenger groups in descending elevators.

swap

private void swap(int i,
                  int j)
Swaps the references of the two elements with the given indices

Parameters:
i - - the position of the first element
j - - the position of the second element

add

public boolean add(Passenger pass)
Adds a new passenger to this group if there is room. Returns true if the addition was successful (there was room), and false if it was unsuccessful. The passenger added is placed in the proper place within the internal heap representation in the group.

Note that Passenger.onboard is set to true if the passenger is successfully added to the group.

Parameters:
pass - - the passenger to add
Returns:
true if successfully added, false otherwise

moveUp

private void moveUp(int indx)
This recursive method will compare the element at the given index with the the element's parent (index/2) if needed it will swap the elements and recursively call itself

Parameters:
indx - - index of the element to compare to it's parent

remove

public Passenger remove()
Removes the passenger with greatest priority from this group, restoring order to the heap afterwards

Note that Passenger.onboard is set to false for the passenger removed from this group

Returns:
the passenger

moveDown

private void moveDown(int indx)
This method will compare the element at the given index with it's children. If it has less priority than either of it's children it will swap with the child (which ever of the 2 has a greater priority) It will then recursively call moveDown on the new child element to continue restoring heapOrder

Parameters:
indx - - index of desired element to compare to child

getNext

public Passenger getNext()
Returns the next person in the priority queue of this Passenger group; the Passenger is not removed from the group.

Returns:
the next person or null if the group is empty

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Indicates if this group is empty.

Returns:
true if empty, false otherwise

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Indicates if this group is full

Returns:
true if full, false otherwise

getSize

public int getSize()
Returns the number of passengers in this group.

Returns:
the size

clear

public void clear()
Removes all passengers from the group

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of this group. For Example: Group (5): [empty: false, full: true, next: Passenger: [ 0 -> 2, 0]]

Overrides:
toString in class Object

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Tests the passenger group class by creating and filling a passenger group, changing the comparator being used, and removing all the passengers one by one until empty

Parameters:
args - - not used
